Author: Aleph0-4
Text: In an ideal world, being able to maintain a body in which I like myself in and knowing intuitively how much to eat without counting calories. Never binging or purging again.   Realistically, being able to go out to eat with friends or drink alcohol without it turning into a binge. Not feeling like the world is going to end if I go over my calorie limit.   I've accepted though that I'll never be carefree around food and be perfectly happy with my body image . I'm probably going to watch what I eat and want to be thin for the rest of my life. But that's fine. I just want to stop throwing money down the toilet and free up some mental space to actually achieve real things.

Author: Flesh-And-Bone
Text: no fear foods. enjoying my food without guilt or shame. eating ad libitum. making mostly healthy food choices but also making pancakes once in awhile.
